poem:
### Screen Time

In the pixel's relentless gaze,   
where secrets unfold, encrypted haze—   
an all-seeing eye in digital form,   
spying becomes the cultural norm.   
Through screens, our whispers captured and stored,   
intimacy strained, trust unexplored.   
Orwell's nightmare now coded and clear,   
AI's shadow, our new frontier.
